SEARCH
Package sh.brane.core.crypto

Class Sha256

java.lang.Object
sh.brane.core.crypto.Sha256
public final class Sha256 extends Object
SHA-256 hashing utility.

Provides a simple interface to Java's standard SHA-256 implementation. SHA-256 is commonly used in Bitcoin and various cryptographic protocols.

Usage Example


 byte[] data = "hello".getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
 byte[] hash = Sha256.hash(data);
 String hashHex = Hex.encode(hash);

ThreadLocal Memory Management

Memory Leak Warning: This class uses ThreadLocal to cache digest instances for performance. In thread pool environments (servlet containers, application servers, executors), failure to call cleanup() can cause memory leaks and classloader leaks during hot redeployment.

When to Call cleanup()

  • Servlet/Web Applications: In a filter's finally block or ServletContextListener.contextDestroyed()
  • Custom Thread Pools: When returning threads to the pool or shutting down
  • Application Shutdown: In shutdown hooks or lifecycle callbacks

Example: Servlet Filter


 public class BraneCleanupFilter implements Filter {
     public void doFilter(ServletRequest req, ServletResponse res, FilterChain chain)
             throws IOException, ServletException {
         try {
             chain.doFilter(req, res);
         } finally {
             Sha256.cleanup();  // Prevent memory leak
         }
     }
 }

Example: ExecutorService


 executor.submit(() -> {
     try {
         // ... use Sha256.hash() ...
     } finally {
         Sha256.cleanup();
     }
 });

Note: For simple CLI applications or short-lived processes, cleanup is not strictly necessary as ThreadLocal values are released when the JVM exits.

Since:
0.2.0

  • Method Details

    • hash

      public static byte[] hash(byte[] input)
      Computes the SHA-256 hash of the input bytes.
      Parameters:
      input - the data to hash
      Returns:
      32-byte hash
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if input is null

    • hash

      public static byte[] hash(byte[]... inputs)
      Computes the SHA-256 hash of multiple input arrays concatenated.

      This is useful for hashing composed data without creating intermediate byte arrays.

      Parameters:
      inputs - the data arrays to hash
      Returns:
      32-byte hash
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if inputs or any element is null

    • cleanup

      public static void cleanup()
      Removes the cached digest instance from the current thread.

      Call this method to prevent memory leaks in thread pool environments where threads are reused across different application contexts or class loaders.

      This is safe to call even if the thread has never called hash(byte[]); it will simply be a no-op.

      See Also:
      • ThreadLocal.remove()
